class.name: GodotIKEffector
class.brief_description: Defines a single IK chain and positions its end point.
class.description: GodotIKEffector defines an IK chain by specifying which bone to control and the number of bones included in the chain. It sets the target position (and optionally rotation and scale) for the chain's end point. This node should be a (nested) child of a [GodotIK] node. Additionally, direct child nodes of type [GodotIKConstraint] can be added to impose constraints on the chain.

method.name: get_ik_controller
method.description: Returns the IK controller associated with this node. The IK controller provides centralized access to the underlying skeleton and other IK-related properties.

method.name: get_skeleton
method.description: Returns the Skeleton3D instance from the associated IK controller, or null if no IK controller is set.

members.member: Determines whether the effector is active. If set to false, the effector is ignored during the IK solving process.
The index of the bone that this effector controls in the skeleton.
The name of the bone that this effector influences. This should correspond to a bone name in the associated Skeleton3D node.
The number of bones in the IK chain influenced by this effector.

Determines how the end bone's transform is applied based on the [enum TransformMode]. Options include updating only the position, preserving rotation, straightening the chain, or applying the full transform.

signal.name: bone_idx_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the [member bone_idx] value changes.

signal.name: chain_length_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the [member chain_length] value changes.

constants.constant: Updates only the target bone's position while preserving its original rotation and scale.
Applies the effector's position but retains the bone’s local rotation and scale.
Positions the target bone and straightens the chain by adjusting its rotation relative to the parent.
Applies the full transform of the IKEffector node — position, rotation, and scale — to the target bone.
